passage: The old lighthouse had stood on the rocky cliff for over a hundred years. Every night, its bright beam swept across the dark waters, guiding ships safely to shore. Old Captain Marcus was the lighthouse keeper. He climbed the 127 steps each evening to light the lamp and stayed awake all night watching for ships in trouble.
The old lighthouse had stood on the rocky cliff for over a hundred years...

passage: Deep in the forest, a little squirrel named Pip found a shiny golden nut. It was too heavy to carry, so he rolled it. He rolled it past the old oak tree and down the hill. Splash! The nut fell into the river. Pip was sad, but then a friendly fish pushed the nut back to the shore.

text1: How did Pip move the nut?
Why did Pip roll the nut?
answer: It was too heavy to carry
option1: It was too heavy to carry
